metadata.title: YouTube B-Roll Tips 2025: Improve Videos with Supporting Footage
metadata.description: Master B-roll for YouTube. Enhance videos with supporting footage and cutaways.

hero.headline: YouTube B-Roll Tips
hero.subheadline: Enhance videos with cutaways. Keep viewers visually engaged.

sections.content: B-roll is the supporting footage that plays while you're talking or over your main content. It breaks visual monotony, illustrates points, and hides cuts. Thoughtful B-roll elevates amateur-looking content to professional quality without expensive gear.

sections.title: Using B-Roll Effectively
content: Color grade B-roll to match main footage
Add subtle sound effects when appropriate

sections.title: B-Roll Best Practices
content: Stock footage is worth the investment

faq.question: Where to get stock B-roll?
faq.answer: Paid: Artgrid, Storyblocks, Envato. Free: Pexels, Pixabay. YouTube offers some in Create. Build own library over time. Quality matters—cheap stock looks cheap.

faq.question: How much B-roll per video?
faq.answer: Varies by style—some channels use heavily, others minimally. 20-40% B-roll coverage common for talking head content. Match your niche expectations. Don't force it where not needed.

faq.question: Can I use other YouTube videos as B-roll?
faq.answer: Not without permission—copyright issue. Using small clips may be fair use for commentary/criticism but risky. Stock footage or original always safer. Some creators license to others.

faq.question: Tips for filming own B-roll?
faq.answer: Film extra during any shoot. Keep camera rolling between takes. Capture hands doing tasks. Get establishing shots. Movement adds interest. Build library—future videos benefit.
